verses.text: And Adam knew Eve his wife ; and she conceived , and bare Cain , and said , I have gotten a man from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 4.1 \ft Cain: that is, Gotten, or, Acquired\f*
And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep , but Cain was a tiller of the ground.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft Abel: Heb. Hebel\f*\f + \fr 4.2 \ft a keeper: Heb. a feeder\f* \p
And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 4.3 \ft in process…: Heb. at the end of days\f*

And Abel , he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had respect unto Abel and to his offering :\f + \fr 4.4 \ft flock: Heb. sheep, or, goats\f*
But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth , and his countenance fell. \p
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Cain , Why art thou wroth ? and why is thy countenance fallen ?

If thou doest well , shalt thou not be accepted ? and if thou doest not well , sin lieth at the door. And unto thee \add shall be\add* his desire , and thou shalt rule over him.\f + \fr 4.7 \ft be accepted: or, have the excellency\f*\f + \fr 4.7 \ft unto…: or, subject unto thee\f*
And Cain talked with Abel his brother : and it came to pass, when they were in the field , that Cain rose up against Abel his brother , and slew him. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Cain , Where \add is\add* Abel thy brother ? And he said , I know not: \add Am\add* I my brother’s keeper ?
And he said , What hast thou done ? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me from the ground.\f + \fr 4.10 \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*
And now \add art\add* thou cursed from the earth , which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand ;
When thou tillest the ground , it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength ; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth. \p
And Cain said unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, My punishment \add is\add* greater than I can bear.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft My…: or, Mine iniquity is greater than that it may be forgiven\f*

Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth ; and from thy face shall I be hid ; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth ; and it shall come to pass , \add that\add* every one that findeth me shall slay me.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain , vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* set a mark upon Cain , lest any finding him should kill him. \p
¶ And Cain went out from the presence of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and dwelt in the land of Nod , on the east of Eden.
And Cain knew his wife ; and she conceived , and bare Enoch : and he builded a city , and called the name of the city , after the name of his son , Enoch.\f + \fr 4.17 \ft Enoch: Heb. Chanoch\f*
And unto Enoch was born Irad : and Irad begat Mehujael : and Mehujael begat Methusael : and Methusael begat Lamech.\f + \fr 4.18 \ft Lamech: Heb. Lemech\f* \p
¶ And Lamech took unto him two wives : the name of the one \add was\add* Adah , and the name of the other Zillah.
And Adah bare Jabal : he was the father of such as dwell in tents , and \add of such as have\add* cattle.
And his brother’s name \add was\add* Jubal : he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
And Zillah , she also bare Tubal-cain , an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron : and the sister of Tubal-cain \add was\add* Naamah.\f + \fr 4.22 \ft instructer: Heb. whetter\f* \p

And Lamech said unto his wives , Adah and Zillah , Hear my voice ; ye wives of Lamech , hearken unto my speech : for I have slain a man to my wounding , and a young man to my hurt.\f + \fr 4.23 \ft I have…: or, I would slay a man in my wound, etc.\f*\f + \fr 4.23 \ft to my hurt: or, in my hurt\f*
If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold , truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold. \p

¶ And Adam knew his wife again ; and she bare a son , and called his name Seth : For God , \add said she\add*, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel , whom Cain slew.\f + \fr 4.25 \ft Seth: Heb. Sheth: that is Appointed, or, Put\f*

And to Seth , to him also there was born a son ; and he called his name Enos : then began men to call upon the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 4.26 \ft Enos: Heb. Enosh\f*\f + \fr 4.26 \ft to call…: or, to call themselves by the name of the Lord\f*
